name: Okay, Can You Hear Me
description:
In Okay, Can You Hear Me, cooperation is the key to escaping an ominous mansion with your partner before your time runs out.

As you wake up in an unfamiliar house, you enter a strange dark room. The door is locked, over coms you can hear your partner asking you for help; “Hello? Can you hear me? There is a safe here and I need a code! I can’t find it, ehm, there is something coming through the door?! Help!”

As You realize that solving the puzzles by yourselves is an impossible task, one wrong answer and you see a dark mist creeping up on you. To escape this ordeal, you can’t afford to lose the person on the other side, survive together and get out!

Okay, Can You Hear Me, is a game where you're set to escape a mansion, testing your ability to communicate and solve puzzles under time pressure. To play the game all you need is two computers and a way to communicate with your partner. As long as you have the means to communicate, the game is playable offline.

This game was a four-week hybrid game project made by FutureGames North students.
